properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are occurring. Poor visibilities below 400 m have been occurring for the past 4 hours with winds of 50 gusting to 70 km/h. Conditions are not expected to improve until winds weaken this afternoon. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-21T23:10:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-21T14:37:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0913305683.2020
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. A cold airmass remains entrenched over the central Arctic. Air temperatures approaching -40C combined with wind speeds up to 15 km/h is producing extreme wind chill values of -55 this morning. LIttle relief is expected today, however increasing cloud cover tonight into Wednesday will provide some improvement. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-22T04:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-21T15:32:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3064613172.2020
Area: Hall Beach
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Heavy snow is tapering off this morning from west to east and will end altogether by this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-22T00:44:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-21T11:21:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1129428327.2020
Area: Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, Hay River Region including Enterprise, Thebacha Region including Ft. Smith - Salt River Reserve, Ft. Resolution Region including Hwy. 6
properties.Author: Environment Canada
